seniority_level.evidence: Title is 'Associate Software Developer' at IBM, which typically corresponds to entry-level or associate roles in their hierarchy, despite the data engineering responsibilities.

job_family.evidence: Job title explicitly states 'Data Engineer', and responsibilities focus on data pipelines, storage, and processing.

sub_specialty.evidence: Mentions 'batch and real-time processing' but emphasizes database migration (Hadoop to GCP), CDC, and data replication — all batch/ETL-heavy tasks. Real-time is mentioned but not prioritized.

leadership_expectation.evidence: Role is 'Associate Software Developer' with no mention of managing teams, mentoring, or technical leadership responsibilities. Focus is on implementation and collaboration.

primary_cloud.evidence: Explicitly mentions 'Hadoop to GCP' migration and GCP as the target platform. No other cloud platforms are referenced.

secondary_clouds.evidence: No other cloud platforms are mentioned in the job description or Pass 1 extraction.

processing_paradigm.evidence: Explicitly mentions 'both batch and real-time processing' in the responsibilities section.

orchestrator_category.evidence: No orchestration tools like Airflow, Dagster, or cloud-native schedulers are mentioned in the job description or Pass 1 extraction.

storage_layer.evidence: Mentions Hadoop (lake-style) and GCP migration, which could involve both data lake and warehouse components. No specific storage layer (e.g., Delta Lake, Snowflake) is named.

remote_restriction.evidence: Location is specified as 'Hyderabad, Telangana, India' and work model is 'onsite', implying physical presence in that region is required.

timezone_focus.evidence: Only India is mentioned as the allowed country, with no reference to global or multi-timezone teams.

relocation_required.evidence: Onsite work model in Hyderabad implies relocation may be required for candidates not already based there.

h1b_friendly.evidence: No visa sponsorship mentioned, and location is in India — H1B is a US visa, so not applicable.

opt_cpt_friendly.evidence: OPT/CPT are US student visa categories; job is based in India, so not applicable.

citizenship_required.evidence: No citizenship or work authorization restrictions mentioned beyond location (India). Implies local work authorization is sufficient.

w2_vs_1099.evidence: Employment type is 'full_time' and 'permanent', which in India typically corresponds to regular employment (W2 equivalent).

benefits_level.evidence: No benefits, equity, learning budget, or PTO policies are mentioned in the job description or Pass 1 extraction.

growth_path_clarity.evidence: Mentions 'modernization roadmap journey' and 'collaborative environment' but no explicit career tracks, promotion paths, or levels (e.g., Staff, Principal).

mentorship_signals.evidence: Mentions 'collaborating with diverse teams including scientists, engineers, consultants and database administrators' — implies learning from experienced colleagues, but no formal mentorship program.

promotion_path_mentioned.evidence: No mention of promotions, advancement, or career progression in the job description or Pass 1 extraction.

internal_mobility_mentioned.evidence: No mention of internal transfers, lateral moves, or exploring other roles within IBM.

career_tracks_available.evidence: No explicit mention of IC, management, specialist, or architect tracks. Role is entry-level ('Associate'), so tracks are not defined in the posting.

requirement_strictness.evidence: All skills are listed as 'must have' with no 'nice to have' — suggesting moderate strictness. However, no years of experience required, which softens the requirement.

scope_definition.evidence: Role combines data engineering (pipelines, migration), data science (predictive/statistical modeling), and even search engineering (Elasticsearch, Splunk) — indicating a hybrid or multi-role scope.

skill_inflation_detected.evidence: Associate-level role requiring skills like predictive modeling, machine learning, CDC, API development, and enterprise search — typically senior or specialized skills. No experience requirement listed, suggesting unrealistic expectations for entry-level.
